com.tomtom.speedtools.akka.tokenbucket

Interface TokenBucket

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TokenBucketImpl

    public interface TokenBucket
    Implementation of the Token Bucket algorithm for traffic shaping. See Computer Networks 4ed by Andy Tanenbaum, p. 306-307. This implementation is an Akka actor and uses the scheduler to increment the number of tokens at a set interval. The party that wishes to have its traffic shaped then calls acquire() to obtain the next available token, passing in a callback to invoke when a token becomes available. The callback allows an implementation without blocking any threads.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  TokenBucket.TokenAcceptor
      Callback interface, called when a token becomes available.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acquireToken(TokenBucket.TokenAcceptor tokenAcceptor)
      Acquire a token from the bucket.
      void addNextIncrement()
      Internal method called from scheduler to increment the number of tokens in the bucket.
      void flushTokens()
      Flush any remaining tokens in the bucket (useful after, e.g., token rate changes).
      scala.concurrent.Future<Boolean> isEmpty()
      Returns whether there are any tokens left in this bucket.
      void multiplyTokenRate(double factor)
      Change the rate of generating new tokens by multiplying with factor.

    • Method Detail

      • acquireToken

        void acquireToken(@Nonnull
                  TokenBucket.TokenAcceptor tokenAcceptor)
        Acquire a token from the bucket. When a token becomes available, TokenAcceptor.tokenAcquired() will be called.
        Parameters:
        tokenAcceptor - the callback to use.

      • flushTokens

        void flushTokens()
        Flush any remaining tokens in the bucket (useful after, e.g., token rate changes).

      • multiplyTokenRate

        void multiplyTokenRate(double factor)
        Change the rate of generating new tokens by multiplying with factor. Note that the rate will be limited (both upper and lower bound) in the implementation, specified when the actor is instantiated.
        Parameters:
        factor - The factor to multiply the rate with. Must be > 0.

      • isEmpty

        @Nonnull
scala.concurrent.Future<Boolean> isEmpty()
        Returns whether there are any tokens left in this bucket. Note that this does not guarantee that a token can be acquired, since someone else could be first to acquire the token.
        Returns:
        Whether there are any tokens left.

      • addNextIncrement

        void addNextIncrement()
        Internal method called from scheduler to increment the number of tokens in the bucket.
